ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Have you ever wondered where the state of charge percentage displayed on your iOS device comes from?
The Gas Gauge is a collection of hardware, firmware, and advanced algorithms. The Gas Gauge measures battery and environmental conditions and makes predictions about present and future capacity.
The Gas Gauge SQA team is looking for a highly motivated individual who has interest in learning about Gas Gauging and battery technology. In this role, you will be testing, automating, and analyzing detailed results and working closely with the cross-functional team to ensure product quality.

ul.li: 5+ years experience as a Software QA Engineer
Ability to make data driven decisions on a regular basis
Experience in automation using scripting or other languages (Python, Perl, Ruby, JavaScript, ObjectiveC, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Strong working knowledge of UNIX-like operating systems
Ability to work cross-functionally with other teams and groups
Ability to think creatively, problem solve, and innovate

div.p:
-Setup hardware environments needed for Gas Gauge testing
-Develop test plans and other test documentation as required
-Develop, design and execute tests for validation of hardware and firmware
-Implement automation or write utilities for data extraction
-Prepare, analyze and publish results from planned tests
-Identify, reproduce, and isolate bugs found via debugging and data analysis
-Work closely and clearly communicate with all cross-functional teams
